page.title: 01East of Barnard Castle
page.content: The area is one entirely agricultural with only one major road.The land is good pasture land with cattle sheep and horses grazing. There is a certain amount of grain grown. There are a large number of deciduous woodland and trees, although this only covers a small part of the land. There are few houses and a small population all engaged in farming or related work. The remaining roads are small leading to small complexes of houses or farms. The major road the A67 carries on through to the Lake District and the Dales of Teesdale and Weardale. The local Market Town is Barnard Castle a small but busy town at the entrance to the beautiful Dales.
